website_summaries.verdict: For cyclists that require a durable light set with more good qualities than complaints, it's a reasonable choice.
pros: Offers bright light with 4 light settings
Rechargeable battery reaches full power fast – 2 hours
Easy to install, and comes with a taillight
cons: Battery doesn't last very long on flashing mode
Some reports of lights failing after a few month's use

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Blitzu 320 today. Placed it on my Diamondback and I loved it! Nice and bright with adjustable modes. Powerful. The rear light is good also. Both were easy to mount and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: The_BioMed

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best bike lights! Easy to fix and they're really powerful. Kudos to the team
customer_reviews.author: Anand Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The on/off button stopped working after 2 months (That I can understand) but when I contacted the customer service for warranty they just ignored me.
customer_reviews.author: Milwaukee User

customer_reviews.title: The light is super bright so if it works
customer_reviews.text: We'll need to return this item. It charged 100%, but not able to change the settings or turn it on/off. It has a defect for sure. Reading reviews online to troubleshoot, it has happened to many. We'll return it for the same one, hopefully without any defects. The light is super bright so if it works, it will be very safe and just what we need. The tail light works great.Will update review once we get the second one. Fingers crossed @
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but including a useless tail-light is pointless/irresponsible
customer_reviews.text: The front headlight seems fine - bright and with a versatile mounting system. However, only three stars because the red tail light is a joke - it contains a disc battery (probably CR2032) held in by tiny Philips head screws. In other words, not rechargeable and therefore not cost efficient. What a waste of plastic and a battery you're supposed to "dispose of properly". How about dropping the price and omitting the crappy tail-light, which is basically a disposable waste?
customer_reviews.author: Peter Einstein

customer_reviews.title: Dim light
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing the light is very dim. The brightest setting seems to be the flashing one but it is not bright enough to ride in the dark with. I have some other lights that were priced even less than this one and they were much brighter.
customer_reviews.author: ASlalomskier

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk | No Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for our daughter's bike for her early morning ride to school. We charged it when we received it first time first week of February. I noticed couple of days ago it's not turning on. We plugged in for charge. Blue light blinked on and off. After a whole day of charge it still does Not turn on. I sent total of 3 E-mails. 2 via Amazon and 1 via Blitzugear website still have not heard back. It says there's a one year warranty and customer support. In my experience none exists.
customer_reviews.author: wahidstx

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: This light stopped working after 4 months so I contacted Blitzu. Initial response was great: send us your email and we'll send one out from Kevin. Well that was a month ago. 3 more emails have been ignored. 2 FB messages have been ignored. I literally asked if they were still in business. What started off great has turned very sour. I'm sorry I ever bought this light.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Really Surprised
customer_reviews.text: This little light is powerful! Not to big and looks great on the bars.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Used it maybe twice in the rain and when I went to recharge the battery, it totally crapped out. Pushing the on/off switch..didn't work. Not a fully waterproof item. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nipponfraser

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: The light is bright and easily adjustable. I love how easy it is to take on and off my bike. After a month of irregular use and storage in my backpack, though, the button dislodged itself from the light and fell off. I have to use a toothpick to turn the thing on now, and it's no longer waterproof (the innards are exposed). I'm unable to reinsert the button and ultimately disappointed in the quality of this light. Buttons should not be falling out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY CHANGE
customer_reviews.text: They changed the mounting bracket. It used to be of high quality and would stay on the bicycle frame just fine! Now they have a rubber mount that can easily be shaken off or pulled off. Terrrible quality now. I bought one as a repeat purchase, but will be returning mine and finding a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Moore

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package, charged the light as the directions instructed. I attached it to my bike and the charge lasted less than 15 minutes. I recharged and tried a second time, and the light would not completely charge at all. The result was a dim flicker that lasted only a few minutes. I cannot believe this is a recommended Amazon product. This one is junk. I sent the company an email with a copy of my receipt - no reply as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this cheap product
customer_reviews.text: See last report. Worst bike light ever. Does not stay in locked position, Cheap feeling plastic housing. Another imported throw away product. Extremely disappointed in an item that for the price should have been more substantial. Wrote a note to the manufacturer after they prodded me for information. They never ever contacted me back. I will never buy cheap lights again. In another note, Blitzu makes the "cyborg: rear tail light - which is a great device. Too bad this company is so inconsistent and has such terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: ganache

customer_reviews.title: Effective bike-light system
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this light works! It is bright - lights up the path immediately ahead - function button easily accessible while cycling and the light can be removed from its mount with ease. Charging chord connects easily from laptop to light. Charge time is quick. The downside: The plastic handlebar mount was not large enough for the light to be centered by the stem of my Trek mountain bike. Second, the mount seems rather flimsy but works. Overall, I like this light and the bright red lights that connect to the seat post.
customer_reviews.author: Last Picasso

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Light and Tail light! (but different mount than pictured)
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST model 'BLITZU', as it is made by the actual company and works perfectly!! I tried another one (looks exactly the same but different name on the bike light - but it was bad). Do yourself a favor and spend the $3 more for this one BLITZU and you will love it! This one is very bright for the size, and is very lightweight, and has it a long lasting Li-ion battery, Con: The mount is actually a 'rubber strap' style (the 'cam/lever' mount is pictured) but it still works, and they said they would update their Amazon picture soon to show the 'rubber strap' style mount that actually ships.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Front Light Great - rear light good
customer_reviews.text: I liked the front light, 3 levels of light plus bright blink. Easily installed and rechargeable, I am still working on the original charge after approximately two hours of use. Rear light is easily installed and moderately bright. Several modes of blink and one level of solid light. Problem with the rear light, runs on the cell type batteries, and I am never sure when they will expire. Also currently at about two hours of use and going strong. I wish it were rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Really great light without worrying about batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is a really bright light. It has different illumination settings such as very brighter, dim, blinking. It clamps nice and tight on my bike handle and doesn't move even when I hit bumps. The light can easily be removed from it's holder and the best part is that you can recharge it with a standard micro USB cable. No more spending additional money and hassle of buying batteries. I highly recommend this light since you can use it for night walks and around the house. It came with a rear red light, which isn't rechargable so that's a bummer. But I have a rear red reflector anyways but it would have been nice to have it be rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: Solus Christus

customer_reviews.title: Great light but the rear light is not rechargeable
customer_reviews.text: The front light is very bright and we are pleased with it. However we were disappointed to learn that the "free" rear light, that is part of the set, is no rechargeable. The price is good and the front light is excellent. However, I wanted a complete Rechargeable set and was disappointed to learn that the rear light is not rechargeable. I would have likely purchased a different set if I had known this. I would have been willing to pay more to have the rear light also be rechargeable. Overall, they seem to be good products but if you buy it do so knowing that only the front light is rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: RafticeTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: The light does not turn off.
customer_reviews.text: The light turned on once but could not switch it off. It drained all the power and had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Very bright front white light, rear facing red is noting special.
customer_reviews.text: Red light is nothing special. The front white light was a game changer. Used on a dark path at night, basically turns it into day time out there. Use it to run my dog (I hold the leash on the bike), when we see someone approaching I stop to let them pass and do have to angle the light away to not blind them. Lasts a few hours on a charge. I'm sure there are better lights, better battery life, etc, but this wasn't expensive and was easy to install and use, and really made the night rides a lot better with the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Why only half rechargeable???
customer_reviews.text: After using this light set for a couple of months just found out that the tail light is _NOT_ rechargeable. Why tf would you sell a rechargeable front light with a tail light that requires, of all things, WATCH batteries? Ultimately, this was my own fault for falling for the 'Amazon choice' moniker on this product. Next time I'll do more careful research.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 of these now. The first one was amazing. Exactly as described. It got stolen with my bike. I replaced it and the new one is terrible. Has charging issues and just decides to not turn on after a full charge when its needed most. Luckily I always have a backup light. Update: it has now died completely after 1 week of use. It no longer turns on after a full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Soapcheck

customer_reviews.title: Very bright light that makes me feel safer at night.
customer_reviews.text: I love this light. I have been using it for over a year now and every time that I use it I put the lights on my bike and then take them back off my bike when I'm done with my ride. I leave my bike (which has the front light mount) outside all of the time and it still slides on and off relatively easily. The back light is still working even though I haven't even replaced that battery (the back light is not rechargeable). Both lights are very bright and effective. They are both very easy to remove and take about 5 seconds to remove both. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I'm shocked at how nice this cheap chinese ripoff is
customer_reviews.text: I'm the kind of person with an expensive looking cheap bike, and I want expensive looking cheap gear to go along with it. I'm shocked at how nice this cheap chinese ripoff is. It's bright, secure, feature rich, can be whipped off and used as a flashlight in half a second, and comes with an extra rear light! The battery is plenty strong, the plastic is reasonably skookum, comes in a pretty box. I can't find any corners they've cut! And judging by comments, the QC is pretty good too, its astonishing! Its really with the cash!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with a rubber strap/band instead of what is portrayed in the product photos.
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reason I purchased it other than the amazing price was the quick release mounting bracket. Until I received the product today. I was totally dis-appointed when I found out that it came with a rubber strap/band instead if the quick release as shown in amazon. I attached a photo of what I have received compare to what is shown in amazon. I am returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Dayanghirang

customer_reviews.title: Don’t look anywhere else best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Hi everyone! So I just wanted to stop by and let everyone know that I ordered 2 one for me and one for my girlfriend. We recently have taken up riding our bikes after work and have run a little late (Sun down) and didn’t have anything to light our path as well as letting drivers know we around. We needed some lights and found these on Amazon they are amazing bright lights and sturdy (I already dropped one from 5feet. The headlight is rechargeable which is awesome! The FREE tailight is nice and bright.
customer_reviews.author: Canklesaurusrex

customer_reviews.title: Don't Get it Wet!
customer_reviews.text: I like this light, but moderate rain will murder them. I've bought 4 (3 in the last year) of this model, and only one of them lived long enough to reach the battery's end-of-life. The others have all died from exposure to raid. So that's my review. I think it's a great light, when it works. It's bright; it's easy to use; I love the convenience of the USB charger, but I will not be buying a fifth unit. I'm dumb enough to buy 4 or these things, but I'm not masochist enough to buy a fifth. If you live someplace where it doesn't rain, like the Nazca Dessert of the Moon, you're going to love this light.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! So much brighter than his two previous bike lights put together.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas 2018 and he rides his bike daily. He was thrilled with his new light and uses it all the time. He said it is brighter than his previous two lights put together. Great for the bike trails at night. Thank you for making a great product. We are very happy and would highly recommend. Update: To those that like to see how things last “down the road”. LOVE IT!! My husband has been using it almost daily, minimum of 3-4 times a week and it works like a charm. Great purchase! Glad I chose your product.
customer_reviews.author: SCMoose

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charge. Look for another light by a reputable brand
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2016 and misplaced the box in my tool box and found cleaning and organizing in 2018. knew I had bought it just couldn't find it. plugged in, shone blue at the power button and left plugged in over night. Woke up and turned on, while still plugged in and it worked fine. Unplugged and pushed the power button and...nothing. Doesn't charge. Complete worthless garbage that I'll have to throw out unless I want to attach to a portable battery pack on my bike. Unfortunately, I can't return 2 years later or I would.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Not water-resistant at all
customer_reviews.text: The product description claims this light is IPX5 water-resistant, which means it resists "water projected from any angle at medium pressure (12.5 litres per minute)" and is "waterproof against showers for prolonged periods." This is completely false. After being left out in the rain (just attached to the handlebars, never submerged) my unit began malfunctioning: turning on and off by itself, blinking red LEDs, randomly cycling through different light modes, etc. I took off the four screws on the head and found water all over the PCB and battery. There was no rubber gasket to seal the assembly from water intrusion, so there is no possible way that this design could meet the IPX5 specs. Shameful!
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Bright and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The light comes with a holder that attaches to your handle bars. Easy to install (no tools needed). The bracket stays attached, but you can slide the light off it and take it with you if you are locking your bike in a public area. It’s brightness is good for riding at night. It has several modes: high, med, low, flashing. Battery charge will last 2-6 hour. On flashing it lasts the longest (6-hrs) on high it will last 2-hours. Comes with a usb charging cord and also comes with a tail light that I haven’t used as I already have a tail light. Liked it so well that I ordered another one for a friend’s birthday.
customer_reviews.author: PMC

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive description, beware!
customer_reviews.text: “USB Rechargeable bike light set”??? Not really. The front light is rechargeable but the rear light is not. This is a very deceptive title. They may point out in the small print that they lied in the title, but it is still deceptive. In addition the mount is a weak rubber band affair rathe than a screw tightened clamp. Very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised. Description states rechargeable "set". I always believed that a set was 2 units....as is this a front light and a rear light. Turns out the rear light is Not rechargeable and contains batteries that have to be replaced. This is not what I wanted. That is my big disappointment. The lights themselves are very good and do meet my needs in having front & rear lights on the bike. I believe in high visibility both in the day as well as at night.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, bright, rechargeable light
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The light only takes a couple seconds until it reaches its max output after you turn it on. The beam is very bright, definitely enough for cars to see at night. It's also very lightweight. My kids like using as a flashlight, and I love using it as a flashlight because it doesn't use any batteries! The rear light works well too. Unfortunately it uses batteries though. But in order to avoid bad reviews, Blitzu has wisely said that the rear light is a "free gift" and not actually part of the headlight. Smart move. Overall, very happy with the purchase. I bought this light to replace my older one, and it was a huge upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised - holds a charge for a good long while too
customer_reviews.text: I have had this on my bike for about a year now. It mounted easily and works flawlessly. I rarely need the headlight as I mostly KATY Trail ride, but when I do hit roads I do use the strobe headlight and the flashing taillight for some added safety. I have not charged the headlight in forever - maybe last fall - and it still strobed fine today. I use the taillight a LOT and it still seems as bright as the day I bought it. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: GoMizzou99

customer_reviews.title: Amazing that after a one hour ride
customer_reviews.text: Amazing that after a one hour ride, I had left the light on and realized 5 hours later I saw strange light ON in the garage. It was the bike light! Still on after 6 full hours shining brightly (low position) Prior to that, it prob had 5 hours run time and this was all from the first initial charge about 4 months ago! Great safety feature keeping the light on in daylight as I was able to notice other bikers a block away using their lights too. No different than DRL's on cars. Get this light , you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charging port breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Brightness settings are great. Mounting system is fine. The problem with this light is that the charging port easily breaks and the plug for the charging cable actually falls inside the casing of the body of the light. There is no way to disassemble the light and remount the charging port internally. So, once the charge is gone, you will no longer be able to use the light.
customer_reviews.author: Sean B Roslaniec

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine was made on a Friday afternoon
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to give it the benefit of the doubt and say I just got a lemon. My light was great until about its fourth rain storm (medium rain, not drizzle) and people would say I left my light one, It was night time when I parked it for a few minutes in the rain and then it just turned on and for the rest of the night, even after I brought it in it would flash like it was possessed. It was this last rain that did it in because now I can't charge it. I've bought another one...First time, shame on them...Second time shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bussey

customer_reviews.title: Great light. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great light. I really like the quick detachment of light from bracket, extremely helpful when you drop keys in snow at night. I haven’t done a whole lot of night riding so can’t tell you how long battery lasts in cold. I live in AK and ride in 0-36 degrees usually temp is in the teens though battery lasts long enough for an hour and a half ride with no noticeable dimming. Love that it is rechargeable. Only complaint would be that the included rear taillight runs on watch style batteries, would be awesome if it was rechargeable too.
customer_reviews.author: ornery n AK

customer_reviews.title: Mounting clip will not fit handlebars
customer_reviews.text: This mounting clamp is too small to fit over the diameter of my road bike handlebars and my gravel bike handlebars. The company includes an "extra" rubber strip to help the clamp accommodate small diameter handlebars; however, there is limited range for larger diameter handlebars. An inexpensive hexagon bolt with an extra 1/2" to 1" of thread would make the clamp more versatile. Maybe I'll make a trip to the hardware store and rummage for the right hardware...until then, it's relegated to the mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: T.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great on toddlers balance bike.  Very bright and visible.
customer_reviews.text: I pimped my toddlers balance bike with this light set. You can see him coming from a mile away. I love how the headlight is rechargeable. I've only had to charge it once in 2 months. The tail like takes cr2032, but it lasts a long time, especially on blinker mode.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great little light
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much from this little light. I thought the mount would've broken and snapped off by now, 3 years in to it (about to be 4), or maybe the light intermittently turn off or go haywire after a ride out in the rain as other lights have in the past, but it's still going strong as ever. Rechargeable is a big plus too. I'd put this light up there in the "buy it for life" category. Seriously great product and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: For less then $16.00 you probably will not find a better set!!! I’m sure there are better, brighter and last longer, but not for this price point... I paid $10 for a different set, for my son’s bike at the big box store. They are a joke in comparison. I can see the reflection of the blitzu headlight flashing on parked cars in the sun!! The tail light for “free” lol is honestly not bad all though it’s not rechargeable... The headlight is rechargeable and uses a micro usb!! Long story short this a great set for a recreational rider, kids, or short commuter trips.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Kay.

customer_reviews.title: stopped charging and is now useless
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved this bike light. Ended up buying a second one for my other bike AND recommended several friends to buy this light. I love that it's rechargeable because who wants to deal with replacing batteries?! Also the light is super bright, actually to the point that it might be obnoxious but, hey, I want cars to see me. Unfortunately, I can no longer recharge the light because the receiving end of the charger recessed into the light itself and the charger cable cannot reach it. The light is now completely useless. I emailed the company to give them a chance to rectify the situation before I wrote this review, however I received no response. Darn. I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Alison M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this light. I waited a few months to write this review to get the full picture. Overall it’s a amazing light with tons of power in a small cheap package. It’s light weight but well built and doesn’t overheat. Simple mounting and fast charging. It doesnt need charged every use either , I’d say after about 5 hours of the high setting. The free light included is ok but nothing special with non rechargeable battery’s, but I love free stuff!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kazel

customer_reviews.title: The price is right for seeing at night.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I just wanted to make sure that anyone who purchases the Blitzu Gator 320 USB Rechargeable Bicycle Headlight understands that although you're buying a small light, it shines so very brightly! Two thumbs up for the quality, longevity (battery life), durability (dropped it and nothing happened), reliability (holds a charge for days), afffordability, and ingenuity. Light, bright, and holds tight! Great light for simple journeys. The little tail light provided in the package can be seen a couple of blocks away easily. The light can be seen for several blocks! Nice and compact!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bonaccorsi

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof & switch defective because of that.
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof & switch defective because of that. One day cycling in the rain & when I reached my destination the light would not turn off. I had to repeatedly hit the power switch & it took me 5 mins to get it to turn off. I left it to dry out & now it takes repeated button hits to get it to turn on & then to get it to flash mode. The only saving grace is that this light is bright.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Headlight
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this light for months now and it has worked great! I like that it has several brightness options and is re-chargeable - who wants to keep buying tiny batteries that cost a fortune? The light itself seems well made and it mounts easily on my handlebars. It is also easily removable from the mount so you can remove it when you leave your bike to ensure someone doesn't try to steal it. Overall this is a quality light for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline R.

customer_reviews.title: Bright light DIFFERENT BASE THAN SHOWN
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely disappointed when the product arrived and it had a different base than what is shown on amazon picture or on the box it comes in. The main reason for selecting this light over others was the attachment base. The one it comes with now is a rubber strap that is not sturdy if you ride trails. Maybe for roadway riding it’s fine. I was on the fence about returning it however for the price I’ll just deal with it. The light bright for its size!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike light
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Gator headlight. Charges quickly and puts out a bright beam. The quick release mount works well and the build quality seems good. Deducted a star for two reasons. The on/off button can be a bit tricky; requires a very firm press in the exact center of the button. If you press off enter slightly, the light doesn't always change modes although you hear it click. Not a deal breaker, you get used to it quickly but it can be frustrating with gloves. Also, the rear light uses disposable batteries rather than being rechargeable. Would have been nice if they both were rechargeable but for the money, I can't complain too much. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bock

customer_reviews.title: The perfect bike light for commuting?
customer_reviews.text: Nice and bright, charges with a USB cable, easy to remove. This is quite possibly the perfect light. The one thing I would improve is that there are too many settings, so I have to press the button 5 times to turn it off. Would be nice if it would be a little easier. But this is really nitpicking! Overall great product. I ride my bike every day, and with this light I have no worries that cars can see me. My only concern with this product is that it's so good that someone steals it! Luckily it removes with the press of a button so I can take it with me and that's not even a worry.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Lansdorp

customer_reviews.title: Great features and value. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed by this bike headlight. It is very bright at the highest setting, it provides a nice viewing/lighted angle. The bayonet mount is a great and practical feature that allows me to remove the light without having to remove the mounting hardware. The item arrived in a nice box (see photos), the headlight was pre-charged, so I was able to see how it worked without having to wait. Charging it to full capacity was easy and the added micro USB cable was useful. All in all, it is a great value to me: bright, different intensities (as a fixed/constant beam) and flashing patterns, a back light, a cable, and mounting hardware with a detachable feature.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for....😌
customer_reviews.text: This light didn't live up to my expectations. I just got back from a 255 mile bicycle ride and rode 135 miles the first day. I had it fully charged, and it only lasted 2+ hours. On my return trip, I recharged it fully and peddled away at 3:30 in the morning (in the dark) and by 6 am it was dead on the low, non-flashing setting. Thank God I put a second headlight on my bike for my return trip home. I needed it, before the sun came up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wahrer

customer_reviews.title: Handlebar strap does not hold light securely
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of the Gator 320. I'm very happy with my first purchase, but not at all this second purchase. They have unfortunately changed the design of the rubber strap that secures the light to the handlebar. The first time I strapped this new light to my handlebar it popped off somewhere along a 6 mile single track trail. I didn't realize it popped off until the end of the ride--just as it was about to get dark. It's a good strong light for a reasonable price, but it's useless without a reliable handlebar attachment strap. Unless they improve the strap, I can no longer recommend this bike light.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Can you see me now?
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lights! Very bright and having different modes is a plus. The mounting system could use a little work, don't get me wrong they mount fine just would be nice if you could remove bracket without turning a long ass screw. The lights themselves remove from bracket quick and easy but to remove the bracket itself is kind of a pain in the ass. Other than that they are great lights and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Long

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even have a chance to use it once
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even have a chance to use it once. I bought this light to fit my new bike but it turns out that the clip on the light is way too smal to fit on my bike's handle bar. Really disappointed with it. If the front light's clip was a rubber belt like the one that came with the rear light I think everything would be not only just fine, but great.
customer_reviews.author: José Pablo Salas

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lite and it sat for about 3 months. Then I charged it and used it. Worked great. However, I noticed that it was hit & miss when I tried to charge it. I finally discovered the female charging port was loose and after the 4th charge it fell off into the interior of the light. Nice light but this one was a lemon. No button for return now. At $16 it's not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Bongo

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it less then a star I would. Tail light works perfect even though it isn't rechargable. The only Upside to the head light. Other then that it is straight TRASH!!! Stopping working for my GF a week after it was working fine. Button fell off magically & alllllll attempts to the Company has spawned more crickets then needed. The worse thing I have purchased on Amazon. Sad looked as if it would cut it but small things started to fail before the major blow up. No email address, no C.S. phone number & months later No Response for a shit Product! Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good visibility
customer_reviews.text: This light is great for you early morning riders. It has various intensity settings and a strobe setting which I use routinely. It is durable and holds up to the beating of the road. The tail light that is provided is also a great product with various strobe settings. My only suggestion is to keep the USB cable attached to the light. I own two of these lights and due to continued charging, plugging and unplugging I apparently bent the female plug on the light. Simple solution. Otherwise this is a very good light. You can also easily remove it and utilize it as a flashlight if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R Slack

customer_reviews.title: Good Affordable Headlight
customer_reviews.text: The headlight is plenty bright, waterproof (I've ridden in the rain with it multiple times), bullet proof, etc, and the clamp to the handle bars is all plastic. In the year and a half I've owned it, it has stayed secure and easy to pivot. You will definitely need a new tail light (if you couldn't have guessed that). The one it came with burned out after one use and it takes watch butteries. But I'm not bitter about that since tail lights are easy to come by. It isn't high-end by any means, but it has been my rechargeable bike friend for many a night ride!
customer_reviews.author: Dal

customer_reviews.title: Bike Light
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. I love that I can take the light part off and use as a flashlight. The attachment part could be a tad better. It feels sort of flimsy as if it could break at some point, but I still like this one much better than the one my husband just bought for more money. My one downside is that if you hold it with the bike attachment on in your hand, it looks a bit like a hand gun. *** I will just have to make sure I don't hold it like that. ***
customer_reviews.author: Sara Katz

customer_reviews.title: Not a "Rechargeable Bike Light Set" and really dim
customer_reviews.text: This seems like two well-made lights, but I was wanting a rechargeable set so that I would have to deal with batteries. My main concern was that this was a rechargeable set, as it says in the title. This is NOT a rechargeable SET. Otherwise, the lights are easy to put on a bike. These lights are extremely dim. They look like they should be much brighter, but even fully charges they are dim. My last light that recently died was brighter; I would have bought another one but they are no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Kei

customer_reviews.title: Ideal, Affordable and Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a 10 star review I would! Easy to install, easy to use and talk about waterproof! I accidentally left this light in the pocket of my shorts. This thing went through a wash in the washer and a trip in the dryer. I was so upset at myself thinking I just ruined my brand new bike light. This thing turned right on! and has kept going. This product and the company are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mount not good and Tail light bad
customer_reviews.text: The bicycle light is good but the mount use soft rubber which not lasting compare with regular bicycle light mount. The tail light is the worse part. It power with 2 button batteries cannot recharge. I got a defective item also. It's out of battery when received. I changed new batteries and found that it's problem cannot turn off and one side doesn't flashing. Have returned it and bought another one with rechargable tail lights.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Good light, rear not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Good price on the light combo, both installed with little/no fuss, and the construction seems solid. I have been using them for a few months now with no incident until this morning. The rear light wouldn't turn off when I got to work, so I brought it in to investigate. Removed the rubber skin to find water had infiltrated the housing. It seems like this was not the first time (rust emanating from the battery area). The front light seems to be better constructed to resist water. Ultimately I can't complain too much, the tail light is advertised as free- just be aware that it is not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Craig K

customer_reviews.title: I don’t like to give poor reviews-but that’s our responsibility if we are online shoppers.
customer_reviews.text: Not very bright. It’s ok for a kid to ride down the street but not for serious road/pavement awareness. The “free” rear light could have been great. It was bright and had different modes but 1 of the 2 sets I got broke as we were putting it on. The rubber is like a rubber band-snapping very easily as you put around post. Unfortunately, I probably would not recommend. Sorry. Needs some work. P.S. packaging was very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Foster

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set - If You Can Keep It Mounted And If It Doesn't Rain
customer_reviews.text: Ended up buying 3 of these for my bikes. Went on a trip to Key West with family and was not happy at all. First 2 I had ordered came with a rubber mounting strap. We lost one somewhere, and luckily saw the second one coming off and were able to retrieve it. The third one turned itself on with a little bit of rain and we couldn't turn it off or change modes. Switch shorts out and needs to dry out. 2 stars instead of 1 because otherwise they are very nice lights.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Taillight is broken.
customer_reviews.text: The front light works great. The tail light sucks. I turned it on and it worked. It took me a ton of clicks but O got it off, then I turned it on again and it never went off. I then took the silicone covering off and saw the battery cover was cracked and at that point, without the cover keeping the battery in the broken case, it turned off forever. I can't even contact the company for a new one. I have to use Amazon's return button because the contact for help button brings me to an Amazon help page.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Super nice
customer_reviews.text: So far so good For years I used a light and motion 200 lumen light, which now barely holds a 2 day charge. The market for USB lights is vast enough that spending near $100 for a light doesn't make sense. The blitz is all plastic but extremely well made. The mount is secure to my handlebars, and light is secure to mount It's bright, and holds a charge. The rear taillight, while being non-rechargeable, is nice. Small bright, easy to attach. Definitely recommend this set
customer_reviews.author: allonespeed

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: I don't love this bike light - the fastening system is the type that you have to screw on and make sure to have provided inserts between the bike and the light in order for the fit to be tight. It is not the type with the silicon band that you can wrap on. The tail light burnt out quickly - I replaced the battery and it technically worked in that an extremely faint red light emerged, but nothing like it was when I first received it. I hope that doesn't indicate the quality of the front light. I have to charge it more often that I like, but it is functioning fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright and light weight
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it in flashing mode thus far, but it holds a charge for about 5 hours in that mode. It is a little tricky to mount because the mounting bolt has to get started into the threads on a nut that can come out of the housing if you aren't careful. I have not used the included tail light yet beyond turning it on and off. It is a nice small size and good brightness. Is not rechargeable like the headlight.
customer_reviews.author: RR Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Stays on bike well, good brightness
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, good brightness, easy to recharge. I've had some previous lights that either have poor grip strength or the plastic clip snaps, and easily fall off the bicycle while riding and hitting bumps. This light has never fallen off. I had this light, it got stolen (my fault) and I immediately purchased this same model again. I think the battery doesn't hold a charge for as long after maybe a year of use, but it still works well.
customer_reviews.author: tim tom

customer_reviews.title: Poor button design and mount
customer_reviews.text: The mount for the front light is kind of flimsy, but the biggest problem is the power button. Trying to turn it on or press it to change the brightness proved difficult and almost needed two hands. This is a pain while trying to do this while riding. I understand it is built to be waterproof, but it is also designed for night, while on a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Bright, easily removable.
customer_reviews.text: My last light was stolen so I wanted something with a quick release. It's bright, it's easily removable, and it easily recharges overnight. Blinks red when its dying, which is cool. When it gets low enough the light blinks a bit, but not enough to lower visibility. Only issue I've had is that the mount that attaches to the bike started to slip recently. I think it might be because it gets left out in the rain sometimes, but I just have to release the tension arm thing and slide it back over a bit, so not much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Mode switching is out of control after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Less than one year, the power/mode switch button behaves totally randomly now. Many times it does not respond at all -- I press it and nothing happens. And once I turn the light on, it becomes very difficult to turn it off, because it would simply switch between continuous mode and flashing mode and refuse to turn off, and it often takes more than 8 or 9 attempts at pressing that button to finally kill the light. The item has become very inconvenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Zhe

customer_reviews.title: Great bike light in almost everything.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bike around college at night time and it is completely satisfactory in almost every way. The light is extremely bright and also has the nice option of a dimmer light or even flashing for extra precaution. Only minor complaint I have is that it was a little hard to put on the bike at first, but I did figure it out after a few minutes. Overall I highly suggest for anyone who bikes on roads that there are cars on, especially in night and rain (in which it functions fine)
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Nice bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Very bright light and the fact that I don't have to change batteries is awesome! The mounting makes it easy to customize the position of the light to allow optimal illumination where you need it. The quick release is a great feature that allows me to keep the light with me and possibly use it as a standard flashlight if necessary. The complimentary taillight is also a quality product. It is nice and compact but doesn't hold out on light output. I've seen lights similar to this at my local bike shop for close to 70$. Overall it is a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Ok so let's start with the good, the battery last a few nights if u only use it at night with a pretty quick charge time. The rear light last a few weeks before I need a replacement battery. Now the bad when it rains the light gets stuck on till it's completely dead. Also the button has issues turning on or switching to the next setting especially in the cold I live in Philly so its not cold like in the mountains
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The headlight wouldn't turn on at all. I plugged it into charge using the supplied cable, the indicator light turned on indicating it was charging. I left the room for a few minutes and came back in to see the light turned on.... hmm... I unplugged it from the charger and the light turned off. I tried turning the light on, it doesn't turn on at all. When I plugged it back into the charger and press the power button it turns on... but never turns off. If I unplug it... it turns off and won't turn on. tl;dr ... this thing is a piece of junk and doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clawson

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe to Bike With
customer_reviews.text: Mounting system is garbage. Light doesn't 'click' in to anything, even though you have to depress a small piece of plastic to shove it into place at all. There's no retention. Fell out multiple times while biking, had to stop and go get it repeatedly until it finally got run over by a truck. Good riddance. Nice and bright light though! And the included rear light is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Roberts

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This set of bike lights is a gem. The rear light is extremely visible and has a USB port for recharging. The front light uses 2032 batteries; stock up in advance. I didn't spend much time examining it before I gave it as a gift. It wasn't immediately obvious how to change the batteries. The rubber or teflon cover wouldn't come all the way off to unscrew the battery cover. Another minute or two would probably have solved the problem. The front light comes off the mount easily to become a flashlight. An attachment point on the front light would be nice in its use as a flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: J. Null

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like this light so much I bought another one for my daughter's bike. The light is very bright and rechargeable and easy to install as well as sturdy on the bracket. The previous light I got for my daughter's bike fell apart after some while.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Siu

customer_reviews.title: Sold as new, shipped open box
customer_reviews.text: I received an open box item that had obviously been handled / used. This is NEVER OK because you don't know what you're getting or why it was returned. The box was distressed and there was debris of some sort on the tail light. At this price, and with the hassle of a return I just kept it. I have cleaned up and mounted the two pieces and they seem OK, but now I do have to monitor for defects.
customer_reviews.author: Walt B

customer_reviews.title: short battery light but bright.
customer_reviews.text: The light lasts a little over an hour at most on the highest setting. The usb cord it comes with it very poor quality like the gasoline station cable chargers. It’s a bright light but they need a better way to fit it onto the bike. I had to keep turning the lever somehow to get it to hold onto the bike bar... bit confusing. It’s a nice light but needs some longer battery life and maybe a better mechanism to attaching it to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: recommended!
customer_reviews.text: works very well. lid enough ahead in normal (city) evening/night bike ride. better than my friends similar product as it provides a brighter and further coverage on the road - not like some that is bright but goes all over front and up (i.e. not on the road). headlight clamp works well for me too - tight enough it does not move, but easily adjustable if needed. I only use the headlight and not using the rear as i already have a good one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tsang

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this 2-light package from Blitzu yesterday and put them on my bike after I charged up the front light for an hour and the light went from blinking to solid. I then headed out for an hour long ride as the sun was dropping in the sky. I have to say, I am quite impressed with both the ease of installation and the brightness of the taillight and the headlight. I was riding with a buddy who spent quite a bit more for his lights, and these seemed as good as what he was using. Obviously time will tell, but I am quite pleased with the initial quality and performance of my new Blitzu lights. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JP1970

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a different mount than what is pictured
customer_reviews.text: Welp the mount on the package and in the photos here on amazon are Not what it came with. I passed up other lights Because they had the style of mount I received. Not too happy but cant return it because its going to get used today. Guess thats the gamble of online shopping? It functions. Feels light n cheap but it was cheap so not too worried on that end. Hope it holds up. Would have waited to do a review to be somewhat accurate as to whether or not its any good but the rubber strap/hook style mount was enough for me. Not a happy camper but I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Light for a Very Good Price
customer_reviews.text: As I've mentioned in other reviews, I'm on the far side of 80. Since I still ride a recumbent trike 6-10 miles a day, my age may not seem relevant, but it is. I NEED simplicity--and lots of light during dark hours. The BLITZU was very easy to install and is comparable in brightness to a $99 light that I bought for my husband's bike a few months ago. I've only had it around a week, so I can't attest to it's durability, but it looks very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: gaming grandma

customer_reviews.title: The light set came well packaged. It is everything ...
customer_reviews.text: The light set came well packaged. It is everything it claimed to be. At my age, I would have preferred the instruction sheet to be printed in a bit larger font (there is plenty of white space and there is room to enlarge the leaflet). While the run-time of the front light is given, the same is not true for the tail-light (which is not rechargeable) and it would be helpful to know how many spare batteries (CR2032) one should pack. The light, even at the medium setting, reaches out well past my braking distance and the tail-light, in strobe mode, gives others a very clear indication of my presence on the roadway.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus M. Adam

customer_reviews.title: High quality at affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third product from this company. As usual top quality at affordable price. Fix system for the head light has improved a lot versus previous generations (which were already good). I would only improve the fixing system for the tail light. Even then not a reason to complain but to make it even better. Power of headlight is better than that for a small motorcycle. Light and robust construction. Water proof and lasting battery charge.
customer_reviews.author: Alexenkov

customer_reviews.title: Too small and used!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the box was open and light was dirty! Chord to charge was all twisted up and shoved back in the box by previous dissatisfied customer! I have a mountain bike and it will not mount anywhere on my handlebars. The mount is just too small! If you have a really thin set of handle bars you should be ok but if they are beefy look elsewhere! Did not give a maximum size limit in description. I decided to keep the light and use it on my girlfriends bike.
customer_reviews.author: ray maceyak

customer_reviews.title: Rear Tail Light Mount Needs Improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent headlight and very bright. I tested in my backyard in pitch black and the high beam illuminated almost like daylight. However, there is some design features that need improvement. As a result, 2 stars were negated from the rating. 1. The rear tail light is not rechargeable and is held together by a wraparound stretch rubber with a cheap plastic hook. If the hook breaks over time, there goes the mounting. 2. The headlight mounting is also a wrap around rubber. I am not so confident the rubber will hold up over time I returned this product and upgraded to the Gator 390 model from the same manufacturer (Blitzu).
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great light! Came with front and rear lights for about $20. Rear light meant for seat post so it's awkward to use when I need my bag on the rack (I keep it as a backup for my old rear light; rear light is battery operated). Super bright lights, especially the front. Took it for a spin the first night I got it. Very impressed and a huge improvement over my old front light (that only put out 60 lumens). Not sure how long it really runs on the brightest setting since I haven't gone for a long enough ride (says 2 hours). Used for road and paved trail riding.
customer_reviews.author: DRR

customer_reviews.title: Cars can easily see me coming at night.
customer_reviews.text: The light is very bright and so far can last for at least an hour without losing its initial brightness. There are 3 dim settings and 1 blink setting. As for the rear red light, I lost it after it got jarred loose on one of my night rides. This piece is held in place by elastic band and can easily be dislodged on a bumpy terrain as what happened to mine. I purchased a second set since I liked the front light so much. I will just duck tape or glue the red back light in the future so it won't come off. Light is rechargeable using a USB. Back light comes with battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Blitzu Gator 320
customer_reviews.text: The light is very bright, and the quality is great. My only concern is the new clip system to attach the light to the bike. The old one (the one on the picture), is much stronger than the new one. I have both the old one, which is the stronger, and my son has the new one, which is the fragile one. The only advantage that I see with the new one is that you can attach it much faster and easier to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great lights but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light in October last year and had used it for about 6 months. First of all, the light brightness is very good. If you set it to flashing mode, you can see the light reflected on stop signs from a block or two away. Having that said, I'm sad that mine fell when the mounting gear degraded. The rubber wrap that goes between the bike handle and the light degraded quickly. I mostly used my bike for commuting back and forth (usually about a mile at a time) so I'm not sure what happened. I loved the product but disappointed because I was hoping it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Paragone

customer_reviews.title: Great bike light
customer_reviews.text: Overall a really great deal. Waterproof and very bright. The mounting isn't the best, but for a commuting bike this is perfect. Not much more $ than a crappy non-rechargable version also available on Amazon, and yet one hundred times the value. I especially like the taillight. I love this light so much, i decided to review it. But i forgot i had already reviewed it, so here i am writing a second review on top of my first review. This light is great! A terrific value.
customer_reviews.author: Great

customer_reviews.title: My Most Reliable Headlight, Won't take the bike anywhere without it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about April 2017 for my bike because I commuted and had no idea when I would be getting home on some of those nights. I was excellent. For 15 min stretches per night, I could go weeks between charging. This year I could not find it when the bicycling season started. I was in DISTRESS without it. Ordered one and deferred on riding until it was here because nothing else has worked this well for me. It arrived, was in use 2 nights when I found the old one. Lol. But not regrets. Happy to have a spare of an option for one of my other bikes. Definitely worth the money and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Quadradox

customer_reviews.title: Bright LED Light but poor mounting system
customer_reviews.text: The only advantage of this light is it's brighter and rechargeable. But other than that, the mounting system is very poorly made, it's impossible to "easily" release the light, you can't really adjust the tightness of the light holder on the handlebar. If it's too loose then it won't stay in that position, if it's too tight then the light holder might break. Overall the flashlights version are much better than this, they also have a feature where you can adjust the lighting range.
customer_reviews.author: Tim
